text: Edmond Montague "Eddy" Grant (born 5 March 1948) is a Guyanese-born British musician. He was a founding member of The Equals, one of the United Kingdom's first racially united music groups. He left the group in 1971. He is also known for a successful solo career that includes the platinum funk single "Electric Avenue" and the reggae song "I Don't Wanna Dance". Grant was born in Plaisance, British Guiana (now Guyana). His younger brother, Rudy, is a reggae musician. In 1960, he moved to London to live with his parents. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1948 births Category:Living people Category:Black British musicians Category:English rock guitarists Category:English singer-songwriters Category:Reggae musicians Category:Singers from London
title: Eddy Grant
